channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A Weakened Hezbollah Resists Pressure to Give Up Its Weapons
item.description: The Lebanese militant group has lost much of its power since the recent war with Israel. But it is balking at demands to surrender whatever is left of...

item.title: From law firm to AI powerhouse: How Accenture’s Julie Sweet hacked the CEO track
item.description: Julie Sweet’s rise from law partner to Accenture CEO shows that curiosity and range, not credentials, are the new power skills.

item.title: AI is coming for entry-level jobs. Bill Gates says Gen Z may not be safe no matter how well they learn to use it
item.description: Gen Z job applicants are facing headwinds when entering the job market due to AI.

item.title: Former General Electric CEO Jack Welch once claimed the jobs numbers were faked. How did that turn out?
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Greer says U.S.-China talks ‘about halfway there’ on rare earths
item.description: The U.S. Trade Representative said Washington was focused on having rare earth magnets "flow as freely as it did before the control."

item.title: North Korean IT worker infiltrations exploded 220% over the past 12 months, with GenAI weaponized at every stage of the hiring process
item.description: Cybersecurity firm Crowdstrike red-flags a new North Korean software development hire to clients just about once a day.

item.title: An Oval Office Replica Opens, Without Trump’s Gilded Flourishes
item.description: The White House Historical Association recently unveiled its replica of President Trump’s Oval Office, but it mirrors the office from his first term, ...

item.title: Trump ‘Wants His Own People’ in Charge of Jobs Data, and the Ex-Fox Host Turned U.S. Attorney
item.description: Plus, why airlines are making everything “premium.”

item.title: From Triumph in Iran to Starvation in Gaza: Netanyahu Squanders His Moment to Halt the War

item.title: Loni Anderson, Star of ‘WKRP in Cincinnati,’ Dies at 79
item.description: She won Emmy nominations for her sitcom role as a deceptively smart radio station receptionist. Her divorce from Burt Reynolds landed her in the tablo...

item.title: More Than 60 Migrants Dead After Boat Capsizes Off the Coast of Yemen
item.description: The trip across the Gulf of Aden is the first leg of one of the world’s riskiest — and busiest — migration and smuggling routes.
